description: The funeral for Corey Comperatore, the father of two and volunteer firefighter killed in the shooting at the Trump rally in Butler, Pa., will take place on Friday at the church where he was a longtime member.

title: ‘UnPrisoned’ Depicts the Burden of Incarceration With a Light Touch
description: “UnPrisoned” on Hulu is the rare show to focus on the aftermath of incarceration and its ongoing effects on families rather than on imprisonment itself.

title: The Trump Shooter and the Growing Nihilism of Young Men
description: Since the vile, civically calamitous attempted assassination of Donald Trump, some of the ex-president’s allies have rushed to blame those who tried to warn of the danger he poses to democracy. “The central premise of the Biden campaign is that President Donald Trump is an authoritarian fascist who must be stopped at all costs,” Senator J.D. Vance of Ohio, Trump’s running mate, wrote on social media. “That rhetoric led directly to President Trump’s attempted assassination.” Empowered by the righteous fury of victimhood, Trump’s movement wants to cast discussion of his autocratic record and vengeful threats as incitement, smothering the debate at the heart of the 2024 election in a cloying fug of sanctimony.

title: James R. Tallon Jr., Who Steered Health Care Reforms, Dies at 82
description: James R. Tallon Jr., a health care policy expert who as a New York State legislator spurred efforts to expand coverage for the poor, particularly children, died on July 9 in Endicott, N.Y. He was 82.

title: Energy is Prosperity
description: Breakthrough Energy Ad Post Video

title: Rare Attack in Oman on Shiite Worshipers Leaves 6 People Dead
description: Multiple gunmen staged a rare attack in the Gulf nation of Oman that targeted worshipers near a mosque, many of them from Pakistan, leaving six people dead, the Omani and Pakistani authorities said on Tuesday.

title: Corruption Verdict Could Decide How Menendez’s Senate Career Ends
description: Robert Menendez’s Senate career is very likely to end this year regardless of the outcome of his corruption trial. But the verdict may determine exactly how.

title: A New York Jury Will Decide a New Jersey Senator’s Fate
description: They heard from top New Jersey government officials. They reviewed scores of personal text messages and emails. They even felt the weight of gold bullion in their hands.

title: The Judge in Menendez’s Trial Has Overseen Several High-Profile Cases
description: Two months ago, as the federal corruption trial of Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey loomed, Mr. Menendez’s lawyers made another of many requests to the court.

title: Our Reporter on the Classified Documents Ruling
description: A federal judge on Monday dismissed in its entirety the classified documents case against former President Donald J. Trump, ruling that the appointment of the special counsel, Jack Smith, had violated the Constitution. The ruling by Judge Aileen M. Cannon, who was put on the bench by Mr. Trump, differed from previous court decisions reaching back to the Watergate era. Alan Feuer, a reporter for The New York Times who is covering federal criminal cases involving Mr. Trump, explains the ruling.

title: Fact-Checking the Republican National Convention on Energy Claims
description: The rising price of energy was a major theme of the first day of the Republican National Convention, with several speakers blaming President Biden’s policies for the spike in gasoline and electricity prices since 2021.

title: Menendez Convicted of Corruption in Broad International Conspiracy
description: Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey, a powerful Democrat who once led the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, was convicted on Tuesday of participating in a vast international bribery scheme, in which prosecutors said he had accepted gold, cash and other payoffs worth hundreds of thousands of dollars in exchange for political favors abroad and at home.

title: Biden Circle Shrinks as Democrats Fear Election Wipeout
description: In the nearly three weeks since President Biden took the debate stage in Atlanta and plunged his re-election campaign into chaos, his closest consultations have been not with his White House chief of staff, his top communications strategist or even the leader of his campaign.

title: Overshadowed by a Senator, Two Businessmen Were Convicted With Menendez
description: Gold and cash discovered by F.B.I. agents in Senator Robert Menendez’s home were bribes given by two New Jersey businessmen in exchange for the senator’s willingness to use his political clout on their behalf.

title: Joe Bryant, Former N.B.A. Player and Kobe’s Father, Is Dead at 69
description: Joe Bryant, a college basketball standout, an N.B.A. player for eight seasons and the father of the basketball star Kobe Bryant, died on Tuesday. He was 69.

title: Caffè Panna Brings Summery Sundaes and Granitas to Greenpoint
description: Ready for a summery sundae with no less than lemon bar and vanilla ice creams, lemon curd, graham crunch, lemon bar chunks and raspberry compote? It shares the spotlight with granitas, fruit and coffee, all making their debut at Hallie Meyer’s new Greenpoint branch of the Irving Place spot she opened in 2019. The signature cloud of panna, or whipped cream, is parked on top, as it is on sundaes and affogatos. Ms. Meyer is a daughter of Danny Meyer, and her ice creams are freshly churned on-premises in a bevy of rotating flavors, including several made with chocolate. This location is more spacious, with indoor and outdoor seating and a room for parties.

title: Menendez Has Been Convicted. What Happens Next?
description: Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey maintained his innocence on Tuesday and vowed to appeal his conviction on sweeping charges of bribery, extortion and obstruction of justice.

title: Italian Pop Discoveries From My Vacation
description: I’m back! Thank you to my editor, Caryn Ganz, for filling in for me for the past two weeks while I was on vacation visiting a friend in Italy. I was mostly in and around Florence, but I also made some excursions to Siena, Bologna and Rome. As relaxing as that sounds, know that my ears weren’t completely on vacation. As always, I was constantly discovering new music, and I’m going to share some of those finds with you in today’s playlist.

title: Here’s the speaker lineup for Night 2 of the Republican convention.
description: The lineup of speakers for the second night of the Republican National Convention includes Republicans who once criticized former President Donald J. Trump, Senate candidates hoping to deliver a Republican majority and “everyday Americans” who will talk about crime and illegal immigration.

title: What to Know About the Intricate Menendez Corruption Case
description: Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey was convicted on Tuesday of taking part in a complicated bribery scheme in which he traded political favors for cash, gold bars and other gifts.

title: Republican Speakers Wrestle With a ‘Unity’ Theme
description: After former President Donald J. Trump called for a unifying message after the assassination attempt against him over the weekend, some Republicans known for their bombastic rhetoric were quick to oblige.

title: Guess Who’s Not Coming to Milwaukee? Bush, Quayle, Pence, Cheney or Romney
description: For anyone looking for proof of the transformation of the Republican Party since Donald J. Trump was elected president in 2016, look no further than who is not attending the Republican nominating convention this week.

title: Latino Republicans and Independents Back Trump’s Deportation Plan, to a Point
description: Anthony Gavic recalls hearing his grandmother describe her migration to the United States from Mexico in the early part of the last century, and how she settled in Texas at a time when white Americans used the racist slur “wetback” to refer to Mexicans.

title: After Trump Assassination Attempt, Right Points Finger at Female Agents
description: In the hours after the attempted assassination of former President Donald J. Trump, a sexist theory explaining how the Secret Service could have allowed such a grave security failure emerged in right-wing circles: It was the fault of incompetent women in his security detail.

title: Carlos Watson, Ozy Media Founder, Is Found Guilty of Fraud
description: A federal jury on Tuesday found Carlos Watson and Ozy Media, the digital media company he co-founded, guilty of trying to defraud investors and lenders to promote the start-up venture.

title: Larry Light, Marketer Behind Revival of McDonald’s, Dies at 83
description: Larry Light, a McDonald’s executive who oversaw a worldwide marketing campaign in the early 2000s that was built around the slogan “I’m lovin’ it,” which revived that fast-food chain when it was in the doldrums, died on June 24 in Boca Raton, Fla. He was 83.

title: After a National Anthem Flub, Singer Says She’s Going to Rehab
description: The country music star Ingrid Andress became one of many high-profile singers who have had trouble pulling off “The Star-Spangled Banner” when she sang it during Major League Baseball’s All-Star Game festivities before a capacity crowd at Globe Life Field in Arlington, Texas, on Monday night.

title: Israeli Strikes Kill Several People in Central and Southern Gaza
description: The strikes hit a United Nations school-turned-shelter in Nuseirat, central Gaza, and a site in the Mawasi area in Khan Younis, further south. Gaza’s health ministry said both strikes resulted in casualties. The Israeli military said it was targeting militants.

title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘I Was Married to a Terrible Man’
description: It was an ordinary weekend with my grandmother, us making mango ice cream by hand at her large table in Kolkata. “You know I was married to a terrible man. Your grandfather killed all my dreams and made me, a college-educated woman, have five children against my will and cook all day.” With these words, my 80-year-old grandmother took her husband of 60 years, a man revered for his scholarly presence and success, off the pedestal. Her confession elevated my standard for love. That day I vowed to shine bright and never let a man or marriage dim my light. — Gargi Sen

title: U.S. Detected Potential Iranian Plot to Kill Trump Separate From Saturday’s Shooting
description: U.S. intelligence agencies were tracking a potential Iranian assassination plot against former President Donald J. Trump in the weeks before a gunman opened fire last weekend, several officials said on Tuesday, but they added that they did not consider the threat related to the shooting that wounded Mr. Trump.

title: Bangladesh Deploys Border Force to Try to Quell Student Protests
description: Bangladesh deployed a paramilitary force on Tuesday after at least five people were killed during violent demonstrations by thousands of university students, raising the specter of instability in a country familiar with protests.

title: James B. Sikking, Actor Best Known for ‘Hill Street Blues,’ Dies at 90
description: James B. Sikking, an actor who specialized in comically and threateningly stern men, died on Saturday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 90.

title: At Trump Rally, Local Police and Gunman Were in Same Warehouse Complex
description: While a gunman was climbing onto the roof of a warehouse less than 500 feet from where former President Donald J. Trump was speaking on Saturday, three law enforcement snipers were positioned inside the same complex of buildings, looking for anything amiss in the crowd.

title: How the Israeli Hostage Rescue Led to One of Gaza’s Deadliest Days
description: A firefight amid a recovery mission. At least 19 Israeli airstrikes. Scores of Palestinians killed. A Times visual analysis shows how the June 8 operation had such a high toll.

title: Can We ‘Make America Affordable Again’? Should We?
description: The third item on the 2024 Republican Party platform, after promises to seal the border and engage in mass deportations, is a pledge to “END INFLATION, AND MAKE AMERICA AFFORDABLE AGAIN.”

title: How Tucker Carlson Helped Sell J.D. Vance as Trump’s Running Mate
description: When word got back to Tucker Carlson a few weeks ago that former President Donald J. Trump might be wavering on J.D. Vance as his running mate, Mr. Carlson intervened.

title: Videos Show Secret Service Snipers Were Focused Toward Gunman at Trump Rally
description: Three videos posted on social media show that Secret Service snipers were orienting themselves toward the gunman at the Trump rally just under two minutes before shots were fired.

title: Crisis Hotline Has Answered 10 Million Calls, Texts and Chats
description: More than 10 million calls, texts and chat messages have been answered by counselors working for the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline’s three-digit hotline in the two years since it debuted, federal officials said on Tuesday.

title: The View From Milwaukee: Scenes of a Boisterous G.O.P. Convention
description: For a fourth and final night, thousands of Republican delegates, donors and party leaders crowded into the Fiserv Forum in Milwaukee to celebrate former President Donald J. Trump’s campaign to return to the White House.

title: Former Syrian Official in Charge of Notorious Prison Is Arrested in Los Angeles
description: A former Syrian military official who ran one of the country’s most notorious prisons and is accused of torturing and killing political dissidents has been arrested in Los Angeles, according to a court filing.

title: Man Killed Near R.N.C. by Ohio Officers Who Were Helping to Secure Milwaukee
description: Five Ohio police officers who were in Milwaukee to assist with security at the Republican National Convention fired shots at a man in a residential neighborhood on Tuesday afternoon, killing him, officials said.

title: Chinese Billionaire and Bannon Ally Is Convicted of Fraud
description: Guo Wengui, the exiled Chinese billionaire who transformed himself from a Beijing insider into a fierce critic of the Chinese Communist Party and a favorite of the American right, was convicted on Tuesday of defrauding investors of hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: Elon Musk Says He Will Move X and SpaceX Headquarters to Texas
description: Elon Musk said on Tuesday that he would move the headquarters of two of his businesses, the social media platform X and the rocket manufacturer SpaceX, to Texas, escalating an increasingly contentious fight with California.

title: Trump-Vance Administration Could Herald New Era for Dollar
description: Donald J. Trump’s selection of Senator J.D. Vance of Ohio to be his vice-presidential nominee pairs him with a kindred spirit on trade, taxes and a tough stance on China. But it is their shared affinity for a weak dollar that could have the most sweeping implications for the United States and the global economy.

title: With New York’s Help, a Center of Art and Protest to Get a New Home
description: Eight years after the rickety tenement that housed the Lower East Side cultural center ABC No Rio fell to the wrecking ball, a replacement is on the way.

title: Wednesday Briefing: A Turbulent Moment in U.S. Politics
description: Leaders of the Democratic National Committee are moving to confirm President Biden as the party’s nominee before the end of July, according to four people briefed on the matter. The move would quiet disagreement among Democrats about Biden’s viability as a candidate against Donald Trump in the November election.

title: Families Say Shelters Without Air-Conditioning Are Like ‘Living in Hell’
description: The sun was about to set Monday evening and the temperature was still 90 degrees. The air was thick and oppressive. Shaasia Wood and her 4-year-old son were hanging out on the sidewalk, hoping for a breeze, near the homeless shelter where they live in Upper Manhattan.

title: U.S. Accuses Former C.I.A. Analyst of Working for South Korea
description: Sue Mi Terry, a prominent voice on American foreign policy, had a refined palate, a love for top-shelf sushi and a taste for designer labels. She liked coats by Christian Dior, handbags by Bottega Veneta and Louis Vuitton, and Michelin-starred restaurants.

title: California Becomes the First State to Ban Student Gender Notification Policies
description: A year after school boards in California emerged as unlikely culture war battlegrounds, Gov. Gavin Newsom on Monday signed the nation’s first law prohibiting policies that force educators to tell parents if their children ask to use a different name or pronouns.

title: Trump to Rally for First Time Since Assassination Attempt With Vance
description: Former President Donald J. Trump has scheduled his first campaign rally since surviving an assassination attempt last weekend in Pennsylvania for Saturday in the swing state of Michigan. It will also be his first rally appearance with Senator J.D. Vance of Ohio since naming him as his running mate.

title: After Backlash, Marvel Gives an Israeli Superhero a New Backstory
description: When Marvel Studios announced two years ago that it had cast the Israeli actress Shira Haas to play Sabra, a superhero Mossad agent, in its next “Captain America” film, the news was cheered by Israelis and denounced by Palestinians.

title: A Giant Offshore Wind Turbine Blade Breaks, Prompting Beach Closures
description: Debris from a damaged wind turbine blade has been washing up on the shores of Nantucket, Mass., prompting the closure of several beaches to swimmers and spurring an investigation into what caused the mishap.

title: Widow of Slain Rally Attendee Says She Received Call From Trump
description: The widow of the slain victim in Saturday’s shooting in Pennsylvania spoke with former President Donald J. Trump on Tuesday, she said in a social media post.

title: The Sex Advice That Changed Us
description: Jason Heuer was 12 years old when he asked his dad to give him “the sex talk” during a drive to the grocery store.

title: Senator Menendez Was Convicted of Corruption
description: Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey, once a powerful Democrat in the Senate, was convicted today of participating in a vast international bribery scheme, in which he was accused of accepting gold, cash and other payoffs in exchange for political favors.

title: Israeli Airstrikes Kill Over 20, Gazans Say, and Hit Another U.N. Building
description: Two Israeli strikes killed more than 20 people in the Gaza Strip on Tuesday, including at a United Nations school turned shelter, according to local health officials, the latest in a string of recent bombardments that have hit U.N. buildings in the enclave.

title: Daughter-in-Law and Party Chief: Lara Trump’s Dual Roles
description: Donald J. Trump was discussing his dynasty.

title: Biden Finally Got Border Numbers Down. Will He See the Political Benefits?
description: The number of migrants crossing the southern border has dropped sharply since the Biden administration imposed severe restrictions on asylum last month.

title: Herbert Hoelter, Prison Consultant to the Rich and Infamous, Dies at 73
description: In the summer of 2003, as Martha Stewart’s trial on charges connected to securities fraud was nearing its conclusion, the CNN news anchor Anderson Cooper aired a segment speculating about how severe her punishment would be if she were convicted.

title: Resurgent Trump Has Democrats in Swing Districts Despondent
description: Adam Frisch, a Democrat trying to flip a Republican House seat in Colorado, was frustrated enough that calls for President Biden to step aside — including his own — were having little impact on the president.

title: The Art of Getting a Real Answer Out of a President
description: At a moment of maximum peril for Joe Biden’s campaign, all anyone wanted to know was whether the president was still fit for the challenges of the Oval Office — and whether he would be for the next four years.

title: For Milwaukee, the R.N.C. Is an Unloved Houseguest
description: Good evening. Tonight, my colleague Julie Bosman — a Wisconsin native — is covering the uneasy relationship between Milwaukee and the Republican National Convention. And, as the convention turns its focus to immigration tonight, we’re also covering the conspiracy theories percolating here. — Jess Bidgood

title: Biden Considers Pushing for Major Changes to the Supreme Court
description: President Biden is seriously considering legislative proposals that would dramatically alter the Supreme Court, including imposing term limits and an enforceable code of ethics on the justices, according to a person familiar with the ongoing discussions.

title: Naomi Pomeroy, 49, Chef Who Made Portland a Dining Destination, Dies
description: Update: On Wednesday, the sheriff’s office in Benton County, Ore., said that Ms. Pomeroy’s body had been recovered from the Willamette River.

title: How the Trump Prosecutions Could End Up Weakening Prosecutors
description: The practical effect of Judge Aileen M. Cannon’s bombshell decision this week tossing out former President Donald J. Trump’s classified documents case was immediately clear.

title: What to Know About ‘Hillbilly Elegy,’ Based on the J.D. Vance Memoir
description: Before J.D. Vance became the Republican vice-presidential nominee or even ventured into politics, he was best known as the author of “Hillbilly Elegy,” a memoir about growing up in the Rust Belt and Appalachia. Published in 2016, the book became a surprise best seller, offering one kind of answer to those searching for an explanation for Donald Trump’s presidential victory and trying to understand the experience of impoverished white Americans.

title: The Secret of Trump’s Resurrection
description: In November 2022, after the Republicans’ lackluster showing in the midterms, I wrote a column titled “Donald Trump Is Finally Finished.” I keep a printed copy on my desk as a humbling reminder of how wrong I can be.

title: Chris Christie: Will Trump Meet the Moment?
description: There is no place for political violence in this country. That is the recurring sentiment expressed by elected officials and political leaders since the attempted assassination of Donald Trump.

title: Father Is Charged After His Infant Daughter Dies in a Hot Car
description: A New Jersey man was charged on Tuesday in the death of his 8-week-old daughter, who, prosecutors said, had been left alone in his car for an extended period on a day when local temperatures reached the mid-90s.

title: New Jersey 10th Congressional District Special Primary Election Results
description: Get live results and maps from the 2024 New Jersey special primary election.

title: Former White House Doctor Describes Tending to Trump’s Wounded Ear
description: Representative Ronny Jackson, Republican of Texas, was on Donald J. Trump’s plane on Sunday afternoon, the day after the former president survived an assassination attempt, when he quickly reverted to his role of doctor.

title: Rupert Murdoch Shows Up at Republican Convention
description: The Trump-Murdoch alliance appears alive again.

title: Our Reporter on the G.O.P.’s Hard-Line Immigration Stance
description: Republicans have adopted a platform that is in line with former President Donald Trump’s hard-line approach and rhetoric on the issue of immigration.

title: Guns Are Woven Into the Life of Shooter’s Hometown
description: Thomas Crooks did not have to look far beyond his hometown in western Pennsylvania to find opportunities to arm himself, buy ammunition and practice shooting before he headed to a political rally last weekend and tried to assassinate former President Donald J. Trump.

title: Babydog, a Plump Bulldog Who Is Apparently a Republican, Charms the R.N.C.
description: The crowd gathered on the second night of the Republican National Convention was promised a 60-pound bulldog. And when Gov. Jim Justice of West Virginia walked on to the stage without one on Tuesday night, they began shouting the dog’s name in annoyance.

title: West Virginia Governor Brings His Dog Onstage at R.N.C.
description: Gov. Jim Justice of West Virginia, who is running for Senate, was accompanied by his dog, Babydog, during his speech at the Republican National Convention.

title: At Moms for Liberty Event, Ron DeSantis Was a Throwback to an Earlier Time
description: When Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida took the stage on Tuesday afternoon for the first time during the Republican National Convention, at an ornate old theater down the street from the arena where the convention was unfolding, it was possible to glimpse a moment he had imagined a year ago when he started what became his failed presidential campaign.

title: Is That a Meteor Over Manhattan? New Yorkers Glance Up, Then Shrug.
description: New Yorkers have lived through their fair share of unusual events recently. There was an earthquake, an eclipse and the criminal trial of a former United States president, all against the backdrop of nail-biting national political crises and the hottest year on record.

title: Reservoir Creator
description: Jump to: Today’s Theme | Tricky Clues

title: Brother of Rachel Morin, Mother Killed While Jogging, Speaks at R.N.C.
description: As Republicans focus on crime and immigration during the second night of their convention, Michael Morin, the brother of Rachel Morin, a 37-year-old mother of five who was killed while exercising on a scenic trail in Maryland last August, took the stage.

title: Winston, Celebrity Gorilla at the San Diego Zoo Safari Park, Dies at 52
description: Winston, a silverback who ruled over a peaceful gorilla kingdom at the San Diego Zoo Safari Park for decades and whose 451-pound frame concealed his tender personality, died on Saturday. He was 52.

title: N.B.A. Board Backs TV Rights Deals, but Steps Remain
description: The National Basketball Association’s Board of Governors has approved a set of agreements for the rights to show the league’s games, Commissioner Adam Silver said on Tuesday, moving one step closer to completing deals that would reshape how the sport is watched over the next decade.

title: Nikki Haley Says Trump Has Her ‘Strong Endorsement’ for President
description: Nikki Haley, who was initially not invited to the convention, received an invitation from Mr. Trump following Sunday’s assassination attempt and accepted it in the name of “unity.”

title: Nikki Haley Endorses Trump and Urges Republicans to Unite Behind Him
description: Nikki Haley, who held out the longest among the rivals of former President Donald J. Trump in the Republican primaries, formally endorsed him on Tuesday at the party’s nominating convention, urging her supporters to set aside their disagreements and stand united with their party for the good of the nation.

title: Quotation of the Day: Bullet’s Graze Seen as Sign of ‘God’s Protection’
description: “I mean, he turned his head right when the bullet went past him.”

title: Corrections: July 17, 2024
description: An article on Saturday about the ways in which former President Trump has blurred the lines between politics and business misstated the location of 45footwear L.L.C., the company selling Mr. Trump’s $399 golden sneakers. It is in a lawyer’s office in Wyoming, not Montana.

title: Mother Whose Son Died of Fentanyl Poisoning Brings Some Delegates to Tears
description: Anne Fundner, a California woman whose 15-year-old son died in 2022 after taking pills laced with fentanyl, faulted President Biden on Tuesday night over his border policies and the flow of illegal opioids into the United States during an emotional speech at the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee.

title: To Revitalize Britain’s Economy, a Plan for a Stronger Government Role
description: The last time a freshly minted Labour government unabashedly campaigned on an ambitious national industrial policy to revive the British economy was 50 years ago, and the results were generally viewed as disastrous.

title: A Guide to the King’s Speech: Crown Jewels, Black Rod and a Mace
description: A “hostage,” a search for explosives, heaps of royal jewels and a five-foot mace. Welcome to the reopening of Britain’s Parliament, replete with ancient traditions and elaborate rituals.

title: ‘Sinners’ and ‘Russian Talibans’: A Holy War Roils a Once Placid Village
description: The village was a placid place until the local priest, disoriented by the war in Ukraine, succumbed to Satan, according to the retired teacher in northern Moldova. Before that, people got on well and attended Sunday services at the same Russian Orthodox Church.

title: Wednesday Briefing
description: As President Biden contends with the rebellion against his candidacy within his own party, he has relied for advice on family members and a few loyalists, who are true believers in the mythology of Joe Biden as the “comeback kid.”

title: Flash Flooding in Toronto Leads to Rescues and Power Outages
description: Thunderstorms brought torrential rainfall and flash flooding on Tuesday to Toronto, Canada’s largest city, stranding residents, submerging roads and leaving nearly 170,000 customers without power.

title: Takeaways From Day 2 of the R.N.C.: The Republican Unity Show
description: The second night of the Republican National Convention was all about unity, in the party and in the nation. But in Donald J. Trump’s Republican Party, unity is not something to strive for. It is something inherent in the Make America Great Again movement — if only the elites in the news media and the Democratic Party would recognize it.

title: Anchovies Are Always a Good Idea
description: To understand anchovies, you need to understand umami.

title: U.K. Inflation Steady as Economists Puzzle Over ‘Taylor Swift Effects’
description: Inflation in Britain held steady in June as the Bank of England inches toward its first interest rate cut in years and economists pondered whether a global pop star helped keep services prices higher.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: Hi busy bees! Welcome to today’s Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Now a Felon, Menendez Sees His Political Future Fast Evaporating
description: Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey barreled toward a confrontation with his own party on Wednesday, as fellow senators demanded he resign from office after his conviction in a sweeping bribery scheme, or face the possibility of a rare expulsion vote.

title: New York City Bill Would Mandate Air-Conditioning for Tenants
description: As New York City endures its third heat wave of the year, a city councilman plans to introduce a bill this week that would require landlords to buy, install and maintain air-conditioning units or cooling systems for tenants during the summer, with fines of up to $1,250 per day for noncompliance.

title: In a Bangkok Hotel Room, Six Bodies and Traces of Cyanide
description: The luxury hotel room, a suite, had been locked for nearly a day. The bowls of tom yum soup and plates of stir-fried vegetables and fried rice had been left untouched. But there was something far more ominous in the room: six bodies.

title: Jon Stewart Razzes a ‘Daily Show’ Guest: Bill O’Reilly
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous night’s highlights that lets you sleep — and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Can Urban Design Have a Gender? In This Vienna District, the Answer Is Yes.
description: On a sunny afternoon this spring, Eva Kail stood outside the gleaming subway station in Aspern Seestadt, a sprawling planned community in northeast Vienna that she essentially manifested from an idea into a real place.

title: Pulp Homage and Art-School Laughs Brighten July’s Graphic Novels
description: A rule I’ve developed is that if a book makes me laugh loudly enough to be embarrassing on the train, I have to find a way to write about it. In that spirit, THE WENDY AWARD, by Walter Scott (Drawn & Quarterly, 200 pp. $22.95), is the latest and arguably greatest in Scott’s screamingly funny series about Wendy, a fine artist whose work about a fictional character named Wanda draws on her own life to a disturbing degree. (Just so you’ve got that straight: Walter, who is a real fine artist, makes comics about Wendy, the heroine of the book, who makes comics about Wanda.)

title: This Stegosaurus (Skeleton) Is for Sale
description: Good morning. It’s Wednesday. Today we’ll meet a stegosaurus that is about to get a new owner. We’ll also get details on Senator Robert Menendez’s conviction on corruption charges.

title: The Most Important Seasoning After Salt and Pepper
description: So often the answer is … lemon. The questions, though, vary greatly.

title: Word of the Day: presumptuous
description: The word presumptuous has appeared in 25 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Sept. 28, 2023, in the Opinion essay “Have Some Sympathy” by Pamela Paul:

title: How Yale Propelled J.D. Vance’s Career
description: When J.D. Vance applied to law school, he viewed it as a pathway out of his chaotic upbringing in working-class Middletown, Ohio.

title: A Kidnapping and Its Consequences
description: “Long Island Compromise,” Taffy Brodesser-Akner’s latest novel, features a wealthy Jewish family on Long Island from 1980 until the present. Brodesser-Akner fictionalizes a true story about a kidnapping and the complex repercussions it has on the family. Sloane Crosley, an author and contributor to The New York Times Book Review, says she has “never really read a book that covers suburban Jewishness quite the way this one does.” “Long Island Compromise” is out now.

title: ‘Aftersun,’ ‘Anomalisa’ and More Streaming Gems
description: Charlotte Wells writes and directs this stunning memory play, which begins as a wandering account of a divorced father (Paul Mescal) and his 11-year-old daughter (Frankie Corio), on holiday for his birthday; the mood is languid and mellow, capturing the carefree dreaminess of vacation, with nowhere to be and nothing to do. But this is no mere hangout, and Wells expertly deploys brief but affecting flash-forwards to snap the story she’s telling into focus, juxtaposing glowing, nostalgic memories with the cold, tough present. It’s a tour-de-force of instinctive, emotional filmmaking, anchored by the dazzling acting of Mescal (deservedly Oscar-nominated) and Corio (who turns in one of the best performances by a young actor in recent memory).

title: ‘Conscious Gardening’: Why Your Garden Needs a Mission Statement
description: Nicole Juday, Rob Cardillo and I were most of the way through taping an episode of my podcast when the conversation veered toward a group confessional.

title: Sports Celebrations Have Become Nostalgia Cosplay
description: After the Boston Celtics won the N.B.A. Finals last month — defeating the miserable-looking Dallas Mavericks in a gentleman’s sweep, four games to one — the star forward Jayson Tatum made his way to the sidelines for a postgame interview with the veteran reporter Lisa Salters. Wearing a backward N.B.A. Champion cap on his head and wiping his face with a towel, he listened as Salters asked: “What does it feel like to finally be a champion?”

title: Trump’s Proposed Tax Cuts and Increased Tariffs Could Hurt Poorer Households
description: When former President Donald J. Trump met with House Republicans last month, he touched on a mix of policies core to his economic agenda: cutting income taxes while also significantly raising tariffs on foreign goods.

title: ‘A Joyful Fellowship of Patriots’: The Best and Worst Moments From Night 2 of the Republican Convention
description: Welcome to Opinion’s commentary for Night 2 of the Republican National Convention. In this special feature, Times Opinion writers rate the evening on a scale of 0 to 10: 0 means the night was a disaster for Donald Trump; 10 means it could lead to a big polling bump. Here’s what our columnists and contributors thought of the event, which included speeches from Nikki Haley, Vivek Ramaswamy and Elise Stefanik.

title: A Slap of a Honeybee’s Wings Sends Ant Invaders Flying Away
description: Asian honeybees have an impressive playbook of tactics to defend their hives: hypnotic shimmering waves to warn off predatory hornets; defensive balls to roast intruders alive with their body heat; and, of course, their once-in-a-lifetime use of a stinger.

title: Megadonors Are Plotting to Change Biden’s Mind With Money. Will It Work?
description: For ultrarich Democrats, this is the golden age of political scheming.

title: J.D. Vance Keeps Selling His Soul. He’s Got Plenty of Buyers.
description: At the outset of Christopher Marlowe’s late 16th-century play “The Tragical History of Dr. Faustus,” the scholar at the center of the tale abandons all the learning he has mastered. Law, philosophy, medicine — none of these have fulfilled his boundless ambition. Instead, he turns to magic, making the fateful decision to sell his soul to the demon Mephistopheles, for what he “most desires” — “a world of profit and delight, /Of power, of honor.”

title: Readers Have Thoughts About the ‘Best Books of the 21st Century’
description: When the Book Review published a list of the 100 Best Books of the 21st Century last week, hundreds, then thousands, of readers weighed in, lamenting what was missing and trading reading recommendations in the comments. Others voted in a reader’s Top 100 poll — stay tuned for that list. Responses have been lightly edited for length and clarity.

title: The Doctor Is Out: What Do I Read Now?
description: It can be hard when shrinks go on summer vacation — especially in a summer when each news cycle seems to bring more upsetting developments to process. And it doesn’t help that the fourth season of the cult favorite Showtime docuseries “Couples Therapy” has just wrapped, so even affordable, vicarious therapy is off the table. Without our weekly fix of Dr. Orna Guralnik’s deep nods and cathartic sympathy crying — and with the good doctor’s own much-anticipated book still months off — what are we to do?

title: How a Network of Tech Billionaires Helped J.D. Vance Leap Into Power
description: Last month, J.D. Vance flew to San Francisco to hold a fund-raiser for Donald J. Trump and to host a private dinner afterward with two dozen tech and crypto executives and investors.

title: Judy Chicago on Coming to Grips With Mortality
description: The Unstoppables is a series about people whose ambition is undimmed by time. Below, Judy Chicago explains, in her own words, what continues to motivate her.

title: The Plain Croissant Is Still the Best Croissant
description: I left the bustle of Petitgrain Boulangerie in Santa Monica, Calif., with a plain croissant still hot from the oven, and though I tried to let it cool, I couldn’t.

title: Focusing In on One Star, Fancams Find a Love of the Movies
description: When I first saw “Anatomy of a Fall” back at the Cannes Film Festival in 2023, I expected that the courtroom drama would be critically acclaimed. I could even imagine an Oscar win. What I did not foresee was the fancams.

title: Trekking Across Switzerland, Guided by Locals’ Hand-Drawn Maps
description: Nostalgic for a time before ubiquitous connectivity, a writer ditched his phone and relied instead on serendipity — and maps made by people he met along the way.

title: When Is a Stand-Up Special Like ‘The Wire’? When Ali Siddiq Is Onstage
description: In “The Domino Effect,” a genre-defying autobiographical epic on YouTube, the comic Ali Siddiq begins one part by casually asking the audience a question: “Has anyone here been duct-taped and thrown in a trunk?”

title: Donald Trump’s Choice for V.P. ‘Is Not a Unity Pick’
description: J.D. Vance has gone from a working-class memoirist to the Republican vice-presidential nominee. Here, the Opinion writer Michelle Cottle introduces listeners to the man whom Donald Trump has picked to be his running mate. Plus, hear what Republican National Convention attendees think of the winner of the Republican veepstakes so far.

title: Biden Must Know How This Should End
description: The horrible assassination attempt on Donald Trump has underscored Joe Biden’s dire political situation. Americans hope the awful events in Butler, Pa., will inspire the reversal of our ever-coarsening political culture, as Mr. Biden called for on Sunday night. It’s now Mr. Trump’s turn, and his moment, to answer that call with a more unifying vision as his party meets this week in Milwaukee.

title: $400,000 Homes in Oklahoma, Alabama and Nebraska
description: This house is in the Gatewood neighborhood, a few blocks from Gatewood Elementary School and Oklahoma City University, a private school with about 1,400 undergraduate students. It is less than a mile from Oklahoma Children’s Theatre and a five-minute drive from McKinley Park, which has a splash pad and a playground.

title: ‘Finish the Job’ Is a Terrible Slogan
description: As far as campaign slogans go, President Biden’s oft-repeated phrase “Finish the job” isn’t exactly galvanizing. “Finish the job” is a patient gardener determinedly clipping away at that final hedge. It’s an accountant hunched over the last page of his trusty ledger.

title: ‘Memory Saved Us’: How France Blocked the Far Right
description: Until the last ballot box came in from a nearby suburb, Fabrice Barusseau bit his nails: Would he or his far-right opponent be sitting in the French Parliament in Paris?

title: Review: ‘Ain’t Done Bad’ Tells a Familiar Gay Story in Dance
description: The tale is familiar: A young gay man, rejected by his father, leaves home and finds love and acceptance elsewhere. But “Ain’t Done Bad” packages this story in a new form: as a 90-minute narrative dance set to recordings by the out-and-proud country musician Orville Peck.

title: The Economic Theory Behind J.D. Vance’s Populism
description: When Donald Trump on Monday chose Senator J.D. Vance of Ohio as his running mate it excited populists — and unnerved some business elites. Later that evening, the president of the Teamsters, Sean O’Brien, gave a prime-time speech at the Republican National Convention. “Over the last 40 years, the Republican Party has rarely pursued strong relationships with organized labor,” O’Brien said. “There are some in the party who stand in active opposition to labor unions — this too must change,” he added, to huge applause.

title: We Owe Shannen Doherty an Apology
description: Shannen Doherty was difficult.

title: Republicans Share Their Wishlist for Trump
description: We posed a question to R.N.C. attendees in Milwaukee: If Donald Trump wins, what is the first thing you want him to do as president?

title: In Milwaukee, a G.O.P. Transformation From Dysfunctional to Unified
description: For eight chaotic years, Republicans battled in public and private, fighting over Donald J. Trump’s polarizing personality, his divisive policies and his history of electoral defeats through lawsuits and leadership battles, felony convictions and suburban defections.

title: They Lost to Trump. Now They’re All In.
description: On the second day of the Republican National Convention, a collection of Donald Trump’s former challengers took the stage. There were people who ran against him in 2016 — like Ted Cruz, Ben Carson and Marco Rubio. And people who just challenged him this year — Nikki Haley, Ron DeSantis and Vivek Ramaswamy.

title: Biden Looks to Tackle 3 Big Weaknesses as He Courts Latinos in Nevada
description: President Biden hopes to sell his economic and immigration policies to Latino voters in the crucial battleground state of Nevada on Wednesday as he tries to re-energize his campaign after three weeks of instability in the presidential race.

title: Ukraine’s Devastated Energy Grid Battles a New Foe: A Sizzling Heat Wave
description: For months, Ukraine’s electricity grid has faced repeated Russian missile and drone attacks that have knocked out power plants and gutted substations. Now, it is contending with another, more unexpected threat: a sizzling heat wave.

title: Trump Tells Taiwan to Expect a Higher Price Tag for U.S. Defense
description: Donald J. Trump, the Republican presidential nominee, said that Taiwan should pay the United States for defending it from China, a remark highlighting the uncertainties — and high stakes — of how he might handle the smoldering Taiwan Strait dispute if he should win a second term.

title: Wordle Review No. 1,125, Thursday, July 18, 2024
description: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This page contains spoilers for today’s puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.

title: The Connections Companion No. 403, July 18, 2024
description: Good morning, dear connectors. Welcome to today’s Connections forum, where you can give and receive puzzle — and emotional — support.

title: The Surprise Ending to the Mar-a-Lago Documents Case
description: As the Republican National Convention entered its second day, former President Donald J. Trump and his allies absorbed the stunning new reality that the most formidable legal case against him had been thrown out by a federal judge, who ruled that the appointment of the special counsel who brought the case, Jack Smith, had violated the Constitution.

title: A Show of Allegiance to Trump, and Menendez Is Convicted
description: On Today’s Episode:

title: Biden vs. His Party
description: What happens when a politician’s interest diverges from his party’s interests? That’s the question facing the Democratic Party, and it is the subject of today’s newsletter.

title: World’s Rarest Whale Washes Up on New Zealand Beach, Scientists Say
description: Residents of New Zealand, a hot spot for whale and dolphin strandings, are used to finding large sea creatures beached on their shores. But the creature that washed up on a beach in the nation’s south earlier this month — about 16 feet long, distinctively colored, its teeth snapped off — was no ordinary whale.

title: ‘No Fear, No Die’: Claire Denis’s Noir Comes Home to Roost
description: Most celebrated for “Beau Travail,” her sensuous transposition of Herman Melville’s “Billy Budd” to an African outpost of France’s Foreign Legion, Claire Denis could be the strongest French filmmaker of the post-New Wave generation. She is certainly the greatest risk-taker — unafraid to eroticize her male actors, unleash outré violence, or subsume an elusive narrative in a fiercely lyrical force field.

title: Hiker’s Death Prompts Move to Allow Wider Bear Cull in Romania
description: When a wild bear attack led to the death of a 19-year-old hiker in Romania last week, the episode terrified people across the country and inspired a storm of horrified tabloid headlines.

title: Israel Gives an Indication of the War’s Toll on Hamas
description: Israel’s military has said that it had killed or captured around 14,000 combatants in Gaza since the war there began more than nine months ago, an unverifiable and ambiguous number that gives a measure of Israel’s assessment of its progress toward Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s stated goal of destroying Hamas.

title: The Fed Under Trump 2.0
description: One of the hot debates on Wall Street this election cycle is how Donald Trump would deal with the Fed if he is re-elected and, in particular, if he would fire or demote Jay Powell as chair, The Times’s Jeanna Smialek writes for DealBook.

title: The Lost Art of Mummy Smuggling
description: Let’s say it’s 1873. You’re an intrepid Englishwoman sailing the Nile in search of adventure and history and souvenirs. You’ve sneaked a painted sarcophagus onto your boat. You open the lid, unwrap the occupant and admire what you declare to be a “festive object and not at all a funereal old frump.”

title: Lara Trump, Woman in Black
description: She could easily have worn red, the color of the Republican Party.

title: The California Ties at the Top of the Presidential Ticket
description: The 2024 presidential race just got even more Californian.

title: Why Can’t I Forgive My Husband for Dropping Our Senior Dog?
description: My husband was carrying our 16-year-old dog outside for a walk when the dog flinched and fell out of his arms. Her back legs were paralyzed in the fall, and given her age, the prognosis is not good. My husband feels terrible. But he can also put things out of his mind, so I feel alone in my sorrow. I fluctuate between blaming him and saying mean things (“You gave our dog a death sentence”) and knowing it was an accident (“No one meant for this to happen”). How should I handle my resentment? We are the parents of two children under 3, and we’ve been together for 14 years — so we need to keep working as a team.

title: ‘Black Pill’ and the Dark Anarchy of Our Political Moment
description: I found out during a live comedy show that the former president had been shot at. My phone was locked in a pouch and when the first comic told the audience that Donald Trump appeared to have survived an assassination attempt, we couldn’t tell if it was a bit. The second comic confirmed what the first one said, and joked that if this had happened in another era, they probably would have canceled the show. But at this point we’re all so primed for political chaos and inured to news of fresh violence that the audience — including me — barely reacted. In our defense, none of it seemed real.

title: Mayor of Paris Takes an Olympian Plunge in a Beautified Seine
description: After multiple delays caused by a combination of torrential rain and torrid domestic politics, Anne Hidalgo, the mayor of Paris, took to the cleaned-up waters of the Seine on Wednesday, fulfilling a promise that has become a symbol of the Paris Olympics.

title: Judge Orders Boss Who Coughed at Employee During Pandemic to Pay Damages
description: A judge in Wales has ordered a businessman to pay a former employee thousands of pounds in damages for deliberately coughing at her during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Six Questions We Asked 65 Republican Convention Attendees
description: How the party has changed and where it might be going, according to its most committed members.

title: ‘My Spy the Eternal City’ Review: An Explosive Roman Holiday
description: Watching the new teen comedy “My Spy the Eternal City,” the attentive viewer may begin to wonder about the role of Anna Faris. The endlessly inventive performer spends the first half of the movie smothering the light of her comedic virtuosity under a bushel of a part as a humorless high school principal.

title: Bird Flu Is Spreading. Why Aren’t More People Getting Tested?
description: The first step in combating any infectious disease outbreak is detection. Without widespread testing, health officials have little sense of who is infected, when to treat patients and how to monitor their close contacts.

title: Here’s the Speaker Lineup for Night 3 of the Republican Convention
description: The keynote speaker on the third night of the Republican National Convention on Wednesday will be Senator J.D. Vance of Ohio, former President Donald J. Trump’s newly chosen running mate.

title: Insulin: Drugs vs. Dividends
description: Eli Lilly,

title: Flash Flooding in Arkansas Leads to Rescues and Evacuations
description: Water rescues and evacuations took place in northern Arkansas on Wednesday morning, as rising water inundated homes and businesses and prompted the National Weather Service to issue a rare flash flood emergency.

title: What the Main Characters at the R.N.C. Say About the Party
description: The idea that this is a unity convention is a fantasy, says Times Opinion columnist Jamelle Bouie.

title: Who Needs a Recipe to Cook a Hot Dog, Anyway?
description: You might not need a recipe to grill a hot dog, make a slice of cinnamon toast or whip up a bacon, egg and cheese sandwich. A recipe might just get in the way. It’s simple food — why complicate it?

title: Long Holes Look Intimidating, but It’s the Short Ones That Often Befuddle Golfers
description: The British Open at Royal Troon in Scotland this week might help answer a question vexing professional golf. Is the antidote to golfers hitting increasingly long drives creating holes that are even longer? Or is it the opposite: incredible shortness?

title: Biden Called ‘More Receptive’ to Hearing Pleas to Step Aside
description: President Biden has become more receptive in the last several days to hearing arguments about why he should drop his re-election bid, Democrats briefed on his conversations said on Wednesday, after his party’s two top leaders in Congress privately told him they were deeply concerned about his prospects.

title: Amtrak Passengers Face Record Delays From Extreme Weather
description: On June 20, after millions of Americans had suffered through a sweltering heat wave for three days, Amtrak sent an ominous warning over social media: Trains connecting the largest cities in Northeast could face up to an hour of delay from high temperatures.

title: Want to Go Viral? Tell Your Story in 22 Parts.
description: Time is money. That age-old aphorism is particularly true on TikTok, where holding onto viewers for even a single second longer can translate into greater algorithmic reach and, thus, higher earning potential.

title: Why Donald Glover Is Saying Goodbye to Childish Gambino
description: Donald Glover had been walking a New York City street only a moment when a young man, perhaps in his early 20s, called out to him from several yards away.

title: Emmy Nominees 2024: The Complete List
description: Nominees for the 2024 Emmy Awards were announced by Tony Hale and Sheryl Lee Ralph, both Emmy winners, on Wednesday morning.

title: Ford and Mellon Foundations Name 2024 Disability Futures Fellows
description: The Ford and Andrew W. Mellon Foundations on Wednesday named the 2024 Disability Futures Fellows — the latest class of disabled writers, filmmakers, musicians and other creative artists who will receive unrestricted $50,000 awards.

title: Moving in Childhood Contributes to Depression, Study Finds
description: In recent decades, mental health providers began screening for “adverse childhood experiences” — generally defined as abuse, neglect, violence, family dissolution and poverty — as risk factors for later disorders.

title: This Is Literally Your Brain on Drugs
description: If you had to come up with a groovy visualization of the human brain on psychedelic drugs, it might look something like this.

title: ‘Banger of a Recipe, Easy and Better Than the Sum of Its Parts!’
description: Tomato salads may be the go-to apotheosis of summer produce, but corn salads are just as much a rite of the season. Vibrantly yellow, juicy-crisp and pleasingly sweet without being cloying, they are open to whatever ingredients you care to add, depending on what’s in your heart — and your fridge.

title: Amazon Workers Narrowly Reject Union Drive at British Warehouse
description: A fight to form the first union at an Amazon warehouse in Britain came to an end this week, as organizers of the effort fell short by just 28 votes.

title: Why MAGA Nation Embraces Trump
description: To the Editor:

title: What if We Learn Nothing About the Man Who Shot Donald Trump?
description: Eleven of the last 12 American presidents have endured an assassination attempt or a plot against their lives. The same is true for 20 of the country’s 45.

title: ‘Rust’ Armorer Asks for New Trial After Dismissal of Alec Baldwin’s Case
description: The armorer who was convicted of involuntary manslaughter for loading a live round into a gun on the “Rust” movie set, resulting in the fatal shooting of its cinematographer, asked a court in New Mexico on Tuesday for a new trial following the collapse of the case against Alec Baldwin.

title: Promise of a Changed U.K. Comes Wrapped in Royal Tradition
description: At last, a “King’s Speech” that the king himself might have written, at least in its bridge-building, planet-saving passages.

title: Wall St. Journal Reporter Says She Was Fired Over Hong Kong Union Role
description: A Wall Street Journal reporter in Hong Kong said on Wednesday that she had been fired over her role as the leader of a journalists’ trade union that has come under attack by the territory’s pro-Beijing leaders.

title: Robert Pearson, Hair Stylist Turned Acclaimed Barbecue Chef, Dies at 87
description: Robert Pearson, who never lost his cockney accent through a career that began with combat service in the Royal Air Force followed by nearly two decades as an acclaimed hair stylist in London and New York, and that then took an improbable turn into Texas-style barbecue, where he earned renown as the best pit master north of the Mason-Dixon Line, died on July 8 at his home in Manhattan. He was 87.

title: J.D. Vance’s A.I. Agenda: Reduce Regulation
description: Senator J.D. Vance, Republican of Ohio, is a strong skeptic of regulating artificial intelligence. He’s also in favor of reining in Big Tech, companies he says have grown so powerful that they stymie smaller companies’ ability to succeed.

title: J.D. Vance Is the First Millennial on a Major Party Ticket
description: Senator J.D. Vance, the 39-year-old Republican vice-presidential nominee from Ohio, is the first millennial to join a major party ticket and would become the third-youngest vice president in history if elected.

title: What Responsibility Do I Have to Ensure the Safety of an Illicit Cat?
description: My husband and I live in a multiunit building that does not allow pets. Despite this, one of our immediate neighbors has a cat. It isn’t noisy or bothersome, so we see no reason to snitch on them. The concern is that recently we have had a mice problem in our unit. We have tried many mechanical pet-safe solutions, for our health and the health of the neighbor’s cat, but to no avail. We contacted an exterminator who recommends a chemical repellent, and have gotten permission from the homeowners’ association to go forward, but our neighbor has privately expressed worries it could harm the cat. What responsibility do we have to ensure the safety of the cat? We do not want to cause any harm to someone’s pet, but we also cannot live with mice, and a more aggressive plan seems necessary. — Name Withheld

title: In a Porridge Box, an Ancient Treasure Mysteriously Arrives in Dublin
description: They arrived in a Flahavan’s porridge box, their gnarled edges tightly wedged into rudimentary, makeshift foam packaging, shaky pen marks still visible from where the sender had outlined their shape: two paddle-shaped copper ax heads, their hand-carved edges long since dulled by time — 4,000 years’ worth.

title: We Mapped Heat in 3 U.S. Cities. Some Sidewalks Were Over 130 Degrees.
description: Air temperature is just one measure of how heat affects cities and people. See how high surface temperatures, which bring additional risks, can get.

title: ‘The Bear’ Breaks an Emmy Comedy Record. But Is It Actually a Comedy?
description: “Yes, Chef” is now part of Emmy history.

title: E.U. Court Rebukes Bloc’s Executive Arm Over Covid Vaccine Contract Secrecy
description: The European Union’s second-highest court delivered an unusual reprimand to the European Commission on Wednesday, ruling that it did not give the public sufficient information about its agreements to purchase Covid-19 vaccines during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: A Wildly Obscene Term’s Path to Mainstream Usage
description: If you suddenly feel like you’re noticing the term “rawdogging” used widely and in surprising contexts — online, in the office, at the bar — you’re not alone.

title: Absent a Father Figure, J.D. Vance Found Notable Mentors
description: As a child of a drug-addicted mother in southern Ohio, J.D. Vance learned how to accommodate a string of husbands and boyfriends she brought into his life.

title: Biden Says He’d Consider Dropping Out if a ‘Medical Condition’ Emerged
Paris Mayor Swims in the Seine to Show It Is Clean Before the Olympics
description: Mayor Anne Hidalgo took a plunge in the Seine in an effort to show the river was clean enough to host several swimming events during the Paris Olympics.

title: ‘UnPrisoned’ Review: Kerry Washington Handles Comedy, Too
description: Paige Alexander, the high-maintenance mom played by Kerry Washington in the Hulu dramedy “UnPrisoned,” puts her family and friends through a lot. She’s also a challenge for the show’s captioners: Rendering her continual nervous laughter, which punctuates the soundtrack like the sputtering of a rusty muffler, calls for creativity. In Season 1, (laughs), (laughter) and (laughing) were supplemented with (snickers), (snorts), (chuckles), (chuckles awkwardly) and other descriptors of uncomfortable mirth.

title: ‘Our Nation Is Not Well’: Voters Fear What Could Happen Next
description: Before Saturday, when Butler, Pa., became the latest stunned backdrop for the nation’s  political fury, Mayor Bob Dandoy thought of his town as a place that had learned to work around party lines. A Democrat in a Republican stronghold, he had campaigned on consensus.

title: ‘Baby Reindeer,’ the Surprise Netflix Hit, Nabs 11 Emmy Nods
description: The surprise hit “Baby Reindeer,” a Netflix drama about a comedian and his stalker, picked up 11 Emmy nominations on Wednesday, including one for best limited series.

title: Tadej Pogacar Closes In on a Tour de France Win
description: They are the two best riders in the Tour de France. That has been true for several years and has been clear these last few weeks racing up and down the mountains of France. But it seems like Tadej Pogacar is just better than Jonas Vingegaard this year, and now he is closing in on his third Tour victory.

title: This Easy, Summery Bean Salad Has a Cheesy Crunch
description: As a Caesar salad enthusiast, I’ve seen my share of crouton stand-ins. Some are quite good (crumbled pretzels, fried chickpeas, toasted pumpkin seeds), while others are mere wannabes. (Wasabi peas, ahem. Dried apple chips? Don’t get me started.) But not a single one holds a candle to that queen of crunch, the frico.

title: ‘Shogun’ Dominates Emmys With 25 Nominations
description: The FX hit “Shogun,” an ensemble drama set in 17th-century Japan, has been nominated for 25 Emmys, the most of any series this year. The show is in competition for several of the night’s biggest drama categories, including outstanding drama series, lead actor (Hiroyuki Sanada), lead actress (Anna Sawai) and outstanding directing (Frederick E.O. Toye).

title: Manny Jacinto Turns to the Dark Side in ‘The Acolyte’
description: This interview includes spoilers for the first season of “The Acolyte.”

title: Schiff Calls on Biden to Drop Out of Presidential Race
A Milan Airport Is Now Named for Berlusconi. Cue the ‘Bunga-Bunga’ Memes.
description: Millions of travelers pass through Italian airports every year, but most probably don’t know that Rome’s airport is named for Leonardo da Vinci, Pisa’s is named for Galileo Galilei, and Palermo’s is named for Giovanni Falcone and Paolo Borsellino, two prosecutors who were murdered in 1992 as payback for their anti-Mafia crusades.

title: HBO Falls to Third at the Emmys for the First Time Since 1996
description: The last time HBO ranked in third place among television outlets in total Emmy nominations, Bill Clinton and Bob Dole were gearing up for a presidential election and the “Macarena” was sweeping the nation.

title: Thunderstorms Flood Roads and Buildings in Toronto
description: Major roads and freeways were shut down in Canada’s largest city amid heavy rainfall and flash flooding.

title: Emmy Nomination Snubs: John Mulaney, ‘The Curse’ and More
description: Every year the Primetime Emmy nominations go a little more according to form, and Wednesday’s list was perhaps the most predictable yet, with only one very slight curveball in the main drama and comedy series categories (see “The Curse,” below). Here are some highlights from a very short list of notable snubs and surprises.

title: Peter Navarro, Trump Trade Adviser, Heads From Prison to Convention
description: Peter Navarro, who led the U.S. Office of Trade and Manufacturing Policy under President Donald J. Trump, was released from prison on Wednesday — in time to fly to Milwaukee to speak at the Republican National Convention.

title: What It Would Take to Deport Millions of Immigrants
description: When Donald Trump ran for president in 2016, he vowed to build a wall to seal the border and keep criminals from entering the country. This campaign season, his immigration agenda has a new focus: a mass deportation program unlike anything the country has seen.

title: Halloween in July? Welcome to ‘Summerween.’
description: On a hot summer day, Bonnie Barton hosted a festive backyard gathering that looked different from the typical summertime pool party.

title: Jessica Gunning of ‘Baby Reindeer’ Never Saw Martha as a ‘Baddie’
description: Jessica Gunning is still a little stunned by the size of the audience “Baby Reindeer” has found, and the acclaim that has followed.

title: Popcast (Deluxe): Ranking Every Taylor Swift Album, Worst to Best
description: This week’s episode of Popcast (Deluxe), the weekly culture roundup show on YouTube hosted by Jon Caramanica and Joe Coscarelli, includes a conversation about Taylor Swift’s full catalog of albums so far, ranked worst to best.

title: New Polling Shows a Large and Growing Majority Want Biden to Step Aside
description: Nearly two-thirds of Democrats said President Biden should step aside and allow the party to select a different nominee, according to a new poll from the AP-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research.

title: Four Tornadoes Touch Down in Upstate New York, Killing 1
description: The steeple on the oldest church in Rome, N.Y., built in 1853, crumpled. A mural of an American revolutionary was destroyed when the red brick building it decorated collapsed in the wind. The windows of businesses were shattered and shards of glass were strewed across downtown.

title: Renauld White, Debonair Model Who Broke Barriers, Dies at 80
description: Renauld White, who was widely considered to be the first Black American male supermodel and who for nearly half a century was an image of American style, walking the runways for Bill Blass, Ralph Lauren, Calvin Klein, Jeffrey Banks and Donna Karan, died on June 26 in Manhattan. He was 80.

title: Vance Honed Populist Views in the Senate, Auditioning for Trump
description: J.D. Vance, a newcomer to the Senate from Ohio, stood on the chamber floor in April and scolded his more experienced colleagues for their desire to continue backing Ukraine in its fight against Russian aggression.

title: Rubio’s Endorsement of Trump Underscores Reversal for Latino Leader
description: Senator Marco Rubio’s endorsement of Donald J. Trump at the Republican National Convention on Tuesday made the Florida Republican the highest elected Latino leader to fall in line behind the former president. It was also a pivotal point in Mr. Rubio’s nearly 14-year journey from being a rising star of his party to a keynote speaker during the coronation of a onetime rival.

title: What’s in Our Queue? ‘Juan Luis Guerra’ and More
description: I’m an international correspondent at The New York Times covering culture, sports and news in Latin America. Here are five things I am enjoying recently.

title: Britain Approves Lab-Grown Meat for Pet Food
description: Britain has approved the sale of lab-grown meat for pet food, becoming the first European nation to give its blessing to a process that has prompted opposition in other countries.

title: J.D. Vance Once Warned Trump About Lying About Elections. That Was Then.
description: In the last days of the 2016 presidential campaign, when Donald J. Trump preemptively accused Hillary Clinton of stealing an election that many assumed Mr. Trump would lose, his critics included his future running mate.

title: The Olympics Should Stand With Afghanistan’s Women Athletes
description: When the Taliban regained control of Afghanistan in 2021, one of its first actions was to bar women and girls from participating in sports publicly. It came as no surprise to me, one of Afghanistan’s first two female Olympians.

title: Local Officer Fired at Trump Gunman as Gunshots Rang Out, Official Says
description: One of the local police officers deployed at the Trump rally in Butler, Pa., on Saturday shot at the would-be assassin as he was firing toward the former president, Richard Goldinger, the district attorney of Butler County, said in an interview on Wednesday.

title: Jon Hamm Talks Emmy Nods for ‘Fargo’ and ‘The Morning Show’
description: Jon Hamm is back in the Emmy Awards saddle.

title: Chip Shares Tumble, Dragging Wall Street to Its Worst Drop in Weeks
description: Shares of some of the world’s biggest chipmakers tumbled on Wednesday, pulling the stock market down to its worst day in months, as investors reacted to U.S. trade tensions with China and comments made by former President Donald J. Trump about Taiwan.

title: Is Maddow in Milwaukee? No, That’s an LED Screen on MSNBC.
description: MSNBC’s prime-time coverage of the Republican National Convention has featured a typical TV tableau: anchors at a desk perched high above the convention floor, pontificating as the starred-and-striped political pomp unfolds below.

title: Elizabeth Debicki on Her Second Emmy Nomination for Princess Diana
description: Elizabeth Debicki earned an Emmy nomination for outstanding supporting actress in a drama series on Wednesday, her second nomination for playing Princess Diana on “The Crown.”

title: City Councilwoman Is Charged With Biting Police Chief During Protest
description: A New York City councilwoman was charged with assault after a heated protest at the Brooklyn site of a proposed men’s homeless shelter at which, the authorities say, she bit a police chief.

title: Improvised Bombs Found in Gunman’s Car at Trump Rally Used a Radio-Control System
description: Following the killing of the gunman who tried to assassinate former President Donald J. Trump on Saturday during a rally in Butler, Pa., investigators discovered two improvised explosive devices in the would-be assassin’s car that used a radio-controlled initiation system designed for commercial fireworks demonstrations.

title: Emmy Nominations: Our Critics on ‘The Bear,’ ‘Baby Reindeer’ and Delightful Surprises
description: The 2024 Primetime Emmy nominations were announced on Wednesday. James Poniewozik and Margaret Lyons, two television critics for The New York Times, discussed who made it and who didn’t, why Emmy categories are increasingly irrelevant and which nominations made them smile.

title: Dave Loggins, Who Wrote Hits for Himself and Others, Dies at 76
description: Dave Loggins, a chart-topping Nashville songwriter for the likes of Kenny Rogers and the Oak Ridge Boys who also notched his own Top 10 pop hit with the wistful “Please Come to Boston” and wrote the enduring theme for the Masters golf tournament, died on July 10 in Nashville. He was 76.

title: Why the Pentagon Is Warning That ISIS Attacks Could Double This Year
description: Attacks claimed by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria this year are on the rise and on track to double last year’s count, the Pentagon said on Tuesday, indicating a resurgence of the terrorist group a decade after it wrought destruction and death across the region.

title: What Would Persuade Biden to Step Aside? Here’s What He’s Said.
description: Ever since President Biden’s listless performance at a debate last month, he has faced the same question: What would it take for him to consider dropping out of the race?

title: Daniel Craig, Is That You Under Those Bangs?
description: When Loewe’s new men’s campaign featuring a shaggy-chic Daniel Craig dropped recently, it stirred reactions from fashionistas and Bond buffs alike. One general sentiment was: What happened to 007?

title: What to Know About the Trump Shooting Investigations
description: As the F.B.I. investigates the attempt to assassinate former President Donald J. Trump at a campaign rally, Congress and the Homeland Security Department have begun their own inquiries into broader security failures, including by the Secret Service, that allowed the attack to take place.

title: ‘The Buck Stops With Me’: Secret Service Director Soldiers On
description: In the summer of 2022, Kimberly A. Cheatle, who handled global security at PepsiCo, delivered surprising news shortly before a board of directors meeting, according to a colleague at the time: President Biden had asked her to run the Secret Service.

title: Benj Pasek and Justin Paul Approach EGOT After ‘Only Murders’ Nod
description: Season 3 of the Hulu comedy “Only Murders in the Building” earned 21 Emmy nominations on Wednesday — adding to the 30 it had already amassed, along with four wins, for Seasons 1 and 2.

title: Monte Kiffin, N.F.L. Defensive Coaching Mastermind, Dies at 84
description: Monte Kiffin, a well-traveled college and N.F.L. coach who, during his longest stopover — 13 seasons with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers — had his greatest success as the mastermind of a defense that led the team to a Super Bowl victory, died on Thursday in Oxford, Miss. He was 84.

title: The Broadway Actor Who Designs Dressing Rooms Inspired by Her Characters
description: As a child, the actor Krysta Rodriguez would mentally rearrange unfamiliar rooms as a way of soothing herself. The fixation followed her everywhere, from friends’ houses to historical sites. She remembers visiting a clothing store in Paris with her family when she was 11 and obsessing over where she would put a bed if she lived there. “As I’m thinking about it, it was probably a control issue,” she says. “I immediately try to figure out what a space wants to be. Is it a midcentury house that got renovated in the ’90s with all this incorrect architecture? I clear it away.”

title: J.D. Vance Has Written of His Struggles to Control His Anger
description: Senator J.D. Vance’s rapid political evolution from a moderate Republican to a leader of former President Donald J. Trump’s movement is one of the best-known aspects of his life.

title: Thursday Briefing: J.D. Vance Takes the Stage
description: All eyes are on Donald Trump’s running mate, J.D. Vance, who is set to deliver a prime time speech at the Republican convention in a few hours. The political newcomer, who joined the Senate just last year, has had few opportunities to connect with American voters beyond his constituents in Ohio. This will be his biggest chance to do so.

title: J.D. Vance Plants His Appalachian Roots in the 2024 Race
description: Senator J.D. Vance drew a direct line on Wednesday from his traumatic upbringing in southwest Ohio to his new standing as the top lieutenant in Donald J. Trump’s conservative movement, promising the Republican National Convention that he would bring his working-class roots to Washington and help fight “for the people who built this country.”

title: Long Covid and Vaccination: What You Need to Know
description: A summer wave of Covid is surging in many parts of the nation. Infections, emergency room visits and hospitalizations are all on the upswing.

title: Vaccines Significantly Reduce the Risk of Long Covid, Study Finds
description: A large new study provides some of the strongest evidence yet that vaccines reduce the risk of developing long Covid.

title: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Oren Cass
description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like today’s episode with Oren Cass. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

title: Where to Stream 2024 Emmy-Nominated Series: ‘Shogun,’ ‘The Bear’ and More
description: Nominations for the 76th Primetime Emmy Awards were announced on Wednesday. The FX drama “Shogun” had 25 nominations, the most of any series this year. The FX comedy “The Bear,” which streams on Hulu, broke the record for most nominations for a comedy series.

title: T. Rex Dethroned? A Stegosaurus Fossil Sells for a Record $44.6 Million.
description: Sotheby’s sold an unusually complete stegosaurus fossil at auction on Wednesday for a staggering $44.6 million, toppling the record fossil price that had previously been set by the king of the dinosaur world, the Tyrannosaurus rex.

title: Trump Fans Try Playing Nice, but ‘Fight, Fight’ Comes More Easily
description: It was an unnatural spectacle, like watching a dog walk on its hind legs: a convention hall full of feisty Republicans suddenly talking about playing nice with Democrats.

title: Vance Will Introduce Himself to American Voters
description: J.D. Vance is 39 years old and has spent just 18 months as the junior senator from Ohio; he had never even attended a national political convention before this year. But tonight, the newly minted Republican vice-presidential nominee will introduce himself to millions of Americans as one of the party’s most powerful figures.

title: Gunman’s Phone Had Details About Both Trump and Biden, F.B.I. Officials Say
description: F.B.I. officials told members of Congress on Wednesday that the gunman who tried to kill former President Donald J. Trump used his cellphone and other devices to search for images of Mr. Trump and President Biden, along with an array of public figures.

title: How to Spot the Signs of Heat Exhaustion
description: Dangerously high temperatures across much of the United States have increased the risk of heat exhaustion and other heat-related illnesses. Knowing the signs of heat exhaustion and how to treat it can help prevent more serious problems.

title: An affordable housing solution hidden in plain sight: Libraries
description: The other day, I wrote about two new branch libraries in New York City, which share an unusual feature: They’re both paired with 100 percent affordable housing developments.

title: Navy Exonerates Black Sailors Unfairly Convicted After World War II Disaster
description: On July 17, 1944, hundreds of sailors were loading ammunition onto two cargo ships in Port Chicago, Calif., not far from San Francisco, when an explosion powerful enough to be felt 50 miles away killed 320 of the men, most of them Black.

title: The G.O.P. Convention Is No Landslide Win for Milwaukee Businesses
description: When Milwaukee was chosen to host the Republican National Convention, city leaders sold the event to local businesses as a singular economic boost.

title: A Collection for the ‘Summer Girl’
description: Should J. Crew, the retail chain long devoted to preppy clothing, be sexy?

title: In Extreme Heat, Do You Need More Electrolytes?
description: When it’s hot outside, your body keeps cool by sweating. But you don’t just lose water in the process: You also lose electrolytes like sodium, calcium and potassium that are crucial to keep your body functioning well.

title: Biden Tests Positive for Covid
description: Follow the latest news on Biden’s re-election campaign.

title: While Republicans Put on a Show of Unity, Democrats Wrestle With Their Own Rift
description: It would have come as no surprise to political observers a few months ago to know that by the time the summer nominating conventions opened, one of the political parties would be deeply fractured over its standard-bearer and the other would appear unified behind its candidate.
